Comment: Welcome to /r/ask_politics.  Our goal here is to provide educated, informed, and serious answers to questions about the world of politics.  Our full [rules](https://www.reddit.com/r/Ask_Politics/wiki/rules) can be found here, but are summarized below.  * Address the question (and its replies) in a professional manner * Avoid personal attacks and partisan "point scoring" * Avoid the use of partisan slang and [fallacies](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/List_of_fallacies) * Provide sources if possible at the time of commenting.  **If asked, you must provide sources.** * Help avoid the echo chamber - downvote bad/poorly sourced responses, not responses you disagree with.  **Do not downvote just because you disagree with the response**. * Report any comments that do not meet our standards and rules.  If you have any questions, please contact the mods at any time.   *I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/Ask_Politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Author: AutoModerator

Comment: Many, I would say most, states count mail in ballots before the election but keep results internally only releasing them at the same time the other results are made public. Processing mail in ballots takes more time so it's prudent to not wait till polls close if you want timely results.
Author: JudgeWhoOverrules

Comment: I wouldn't say it's accurate that NY gov is likely to be a nail biter. Hochul hasn't completely run away with the race as many expected her to, but she's far from in a very threatened position. Hochul has consistently had a 5-10 point lead in polls. Only one poll has given Zeldin any advantage at all.  NY is usually pretty quick to call, in part because they do a lot of early voting and haven't really had MAGA schenanigans so much and in part because the races aren't usually close. If Hochul performs about as well as the polls expect, I'd say you'll know who's going to be governor before the night is over.  HOWEVER, HUGE DISCLAIMER: these midterms might be REALLY weird, for too many reasons to list, and I wouldn't be surprised if the traditional guys who call elections are a bit more hesitant than usual. So take it with a major grain of salt. It's probably best just to expect results when we get them.
Author: mormagils

Comment: The odds are better than even that in more than a few major races we won't know the winner for a few days.  Georgia Governors race for instance between Kemp (R) and Abrams(D) is probably going to have to go to a recount at the very least. So that one will be more like a week before a winner is declared.    Then we'll have to deal with all the "Well there is no way that a Republican could lose in this state, so it MUST be rigged." crowd.  But we will deal with that (again) when we get to that bridge. (Which is being rebuilt right now due to the Infrastructure bill Biden passed)
Author: Phog_of_War

Comment: Actually, quite a few state ban the counting of mail in ballots until the polls close.
Author: LiberalAspergers

Comment: New York is actually an in between case.   Ballots can be processed and set up for scan starting the day before early voting opens. (Verification starts earlier and actually needs to be done within four days of receipt).   But actual counting canâ€™t start until an hour before polls close on Election Day - though no results can be released publicly until after polls close.
Author: PhiloPhocion
